snippet: A federal health official’s decision came as a vindication for people who have claimed that their cancers were caused by exposure to the dust cloud and debris at ground zero.
abstract: Federal ruling clears the way for 50 different types of cancer to be added to the list of sicknesses covered by a $4.3 billion fund set up to compensate and treat people exposed to the toxic smoke, dust and fumes in the months after the Sept 11 terrorist attacks; ruling is made by Dr John Howard, director of the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health.
lead_paragraph: A federal health official’s decision came as a vindication for people who have claimed that their cancers were caused by exposure to the dust cloud and debris at ground zero.

headline.seo: Ruling to Allow 9/11 Health Fund to Cover Cancers
headline.main: Sept. 11 Health Fund Given Clearance to Cover Cancer
headline.print_headline: 9/11 Health Fund Given Clearance To Cover Cancer

keywords.value: James Zadroga 9-11 Health and Compensation Act
